text: Ranjit Singh Yadav (also known as Ranjit Ahir) was one of the commanders of rebel army in the Indian rebellion of 1857 in Bihar. He fought against British East India Company under the leadership of Kunwar Singh. ==Early life== Ranjit Singh Ahir was born in 1811 to an Ahir (Yadav) family of Shahpur village of Bihiya Pargana in erstwhile Shahabad (now Bhojpur) district. Since an early age, Ranjit Singh was working for the British East India Company, he was a Subedar in Bengal Native Infantry stationed in Danapur. ==Role in the 1857 rebellion== On July 25, 1857, the sepoys revolted in Danapur, Ranjit Singh also participated in the rebellion, they looted weapons from Danapur and marched off towards Arrah. Ranjit Singh along with Subedar Sitaram and other rebel soldiers first captured the Koilvar bridge and then marched to Arrah and joined famous rebel leader Kunwar Singh. ==References== Category:1811 births Category:1858 deaths Category:Indian revolutionaries
